comments.text: I have multiple times had good times hitching towards Uig from here.
July 2019: We were on our way to Uig and we got a ride almost straight away, we must've waited for 10min tops.
Is actually Portree
Hitch right after the co-op supermarket.
The place is good for going direction South! It took me just 5 minutes to find a car, but walking to there is a little bit hard if your backpack is heavy
3 girls direction to EDN, without a sign. we had to walk a bit into the main road (the cars are going fast but they have some space to stop) We found a ride for the half distance.
Hitching long distance is better with a sign because a lot of people going to about 1/2 hour outside inverness
No problems with inside-lane traffic turning off as you may find at earlier laybys on the A9 heading south. Never waited longer than half an hour here - even though it's quite a slog up the hill!
I agree. This road is kind.
Plenty of decent spots along this road out of Fort William. I didn't wait long at all. Rides in the highlands were generally short distances, but also short waits in between. Friendly folk up here.
agree with this guy, easy peasy
just sit by the coop and youl be fine
Nice spot
Heading to Glasgow, it's little bit dangerous getting there from the services but if you get there, there is a perfect spot where the car can stop.
Lots of places to pull over, and got a lift from tourists. Most traffic headed to oban so had to change rides at Ballachulish

Pass of Glencoe, A82; main route from Fort William and the West Coast to the rest of Scotland, lots of traffic, and plenty of space to stop. (parking places) Get rides in the weekends as far as Edinburgh or Glasgow from climbers. Average waiting time; <10 minutes.

Still a very good spot. Caught a ride to Manchester at 2am after about an hour's wait after I had already caught a ride here at 9pm -- unfortunately the truck driver gave me bad info on where he was going, fortunately he passed by here again three hours later to bring me back...
great spot for lifts north - got a lift to scotland within 1 minute.
Warwick services - okay spot to find a lift into Birmingham

Hitchhiking with sign "London M40", the traffic is pretty fast, but I think it's the best spot to get to London, most of the traffic goes that direction. Got 2 cars at once asking me if I wanna go.. wasn't all the way to Central London but was quite close

A40 Eastbound truck stop.
This is a fantastic place to get a lift to the South, as most M40-Southbound traffic from Oxford goes past this truck stop.
Great services, very busy and all southbound! Asked one person and got a lift straight to Bristol! Another time only took 10 mins for a lift to M4
Asked around. Got taken to Leicester Forest services within nothing. Great spot
very good spot for m1 traffic, got a quick lift to trowell services
Someone took us to a Service Station on the A1 from here. Were holding a sign that said South.
Asked around on ferry and found a lift and a place to stay!
The whole island will pick you up!

easy lift to Falls of falloch. some people wait here for a bus up north but i was picked up quicker than them.
ride from Johnny & Kev
Once again a worth the walk. A 10 min wait got me a ride with a really cool person to fort Augustus!! Saw two older bearded hitchikers further in fort william hitchiking a busstop. Thumb only.

The best spot in fort William for north to Inverness, way better than the crappy gas station. Walk along the nice off road cycle path on the right side of the road heading north for 10 mins and you reach a big lay-by. Good visibility, not crazy fast yet, plenty of space to pull over. Ride in 3 mins! Worked well in busy summer as well. Worth the walk.
Good spot not that known about yet but has potential. Got a lift from a holiday coach!
Recently renovated service station. Great for getting out of Sheffield. We asked around for a lift for only a few minutes before getting an empty coach to Leeds!
people are friendly and interactive here, easy to get a lift along towards the M5
A good spot, there's a layby about 1/4 of a mile past the a39 roundabout which is perfect for getting lifts.
Many tourists. Which can also, sometimes, mean many people who are in the mood to spice up their holiday by picking up a hitchhiker for the first time.
Either this is an excellent spot, it I just had excellent luck. But I waited five minutes, and the second car already stopped, and I got a ride all the way to Leeds. I had a sign saying "A1 - North".

Petrol station and Greggs. Great for asking around for a lift but it’s also on a busy road so I waited at the station exit to try and catch both. There’s a road and car park just above the station for someone to pull into
Banging spot for a ride north from the train station. Much shorter walk than the hermitage spot.
Litterally the first car. Good traffic, good area to pull off. If your lift is going the wrong way at the juction north of here, this is a great spot to pick a ride headed north!
First guys I asked gave me a ride to Bristol airport!
Just walk a little further to here and you get a very large bus lay-by!
2mins on a Sunday. The roundabout to the north would be even better but had my sign out just for luck and got picked up in no time. There’s a big shopping mall in Bangor so many cars going that way.

Picked up by two lovely Italian tourists. There are long sections of parking on both sides of the road at this point, so it's easy for drivers to pull in. Due to the exposure and lack of public transport, a lot of people will take pity on you and offer to drive you west (to Glossop) or east (to Sheffield).
hitched back to the motorway after going to the dales for a bit of hiking, was really easy, got there over a couple rides and only waited a few minutes in between rides
Hitched north onto the M1 twice from this spot, never had to wait more than 20 minutes. Plenty of room to pull in at the bus stop and ample time for vehicles to see you as they round the corner.

Very good spot here ! Nice and warm coffee where you can get the best hot chocolate you've never drink...
+ parking of the coffee where you can easily ask the customers for a lift.
Second car I asked took me to the outskirts of London.
Excellent spot to join Newcastle ! A lot of trafic and a good place to park for the drivers, although a lot of of them were going to the south.
Excellent spot ! Petrol stations are always the good place to hitchhike ! 1h of ride until Wetherby.
Excellent spot ! Petrol stations are always the good place to hitchhike ;)
Good if you want to get to the M3, and very close frome the train station.
It is in the middle of the town but the cars are going slowly and there is a bus stop for them to pull over. Good place to go to Glencoe or Oban.
Good spot to get out of Isle of Skye from Portree. Cars can pull over either in a driveway or on the petrol station. You can also try asking the people stopped at the petrol station.
A lot of traffic, most cars driving north from Stirling will use this road. The cars are driving slowly because they are exiting the roundabout and there is a lot of space to pull over.
Good lift slow traffic due to sight li es. No notes really
Cars can pull into the housing estate and see you from the main road, little problem to wait their good amount of pavement

Great spot, maybe got lucky but a delivery driver took me trait to edinburgh. The only problem is getting here if you haven't just got drop of because the closest train station is 5km but still not bad.
Great spot just hard to walk to from Kingussie
Good if you want to head north. People come to eat and stop for gas
Great spot if you want to head north to the M5, we got a ride in 2 minutes

beautiful spot to look around and hitch from. great layby.
lift from George
We wanted to head to exeter. Really busy in summer. Very easy to find rides, most of them heading to cornwall
We were ambitious trying to get to Wells. Got a ride after 30 min. Lots of people heading to bristol, even london
Best to ask parked cars at the service station. Lots of cars heading south in summer but if you are lucky there are some heading north.
If you need to get out of exmouth, great road heading only one way to exeter. We were dropped at exeter services

Really good spot to go on the M2. There´s a small car park where cars can pull over and lots of cars are going on the M2. If people dont leave at the first opportunity they can drop you at the applegreen service station (where I found a ride to Derry)

Great hitch spot! There is even some shade from the trees. Only tricky thing is that there are two lanes, so it can be hard for someone in the far land to pull over fast enough. Good idea to stand at the beginning of the turnout if possible. My ride, who happened to be in the far lane, was so determined to stop for me that he pulled over AFTER the turnout and walked back to get me! I had a sign for Devon, and ended up with a ride to Glastonbury, where I’d been told I should go if possible. Beaut
Best spot out of this town I think. Two women picked up us two men saying, “I gotta help out fellow hitch hikers!”
Great pickup conditions as the car can pull into a bus stop zone. A very friendly local woman picked me and a friend up.
Direction Salisbury, good place in the shade under trees yet good visibility, also enough place to stop. Not too many cars, but got a hitch reasonably fast.
Waited literally 5 seconds, great spot, lots of space to stop, got a hitch all the way to Bristol from here
Not an amazing spot but just doable on the small road, got picked up in less than 10 minutes towards sennen cove and land's end.
Easy, people coming back from hike in peaks, straight to Sheffield, easy place to pull over, good if you are car less climbing at Stanage edge
A lovely brummy couple took us to Manchester after only 15 mins of asking around!
Wanted to see Bamburgh but bus wait was too long from Belford. Got picked up by an elderly couple who took me to town.
Good spot, traffic can see you from miles away, bust in summer, aslo a car aprk where you can ask for lifts, short walk to out of the way wild camp spots
Good spot, local offered me a lift almost instantly, plenty of toursit traffic in summer
I got a straight ride to Wales from here.
Was lucky that the first people I saw, they were a lovely French family sailing the next morning to Isle of Man, so I couchsurfed on their boat for the night and then got a passage across.

There’s lots of space for cars to pull in and they can see you from the distance. Got a ride with a van with people who had passed me before but they had made a stop somewhere so after seeing me again they stopped and were on their way up to England, so I got to Aberystwyth where I wanted to get for the night.
There wasn’t too much traffic.
Good traffic, most of it is going to Manchester tho.

There is a little bit of space for going south, a few cars, and they're slowed by the turn. Due to my experiances with thousands of cars ignoring me in a perfect spot earlier I was in a terrible mood and fully expected to be stranded here all night, but after 10mins a campervan actually came from the other direction and offered me a ride to beyond Fort william!! they'd seen me previously, felt bad and came back for me. Good people exist afterall!
Most offers were towards Chester,  but I got lucky and got a truck ride all the way to Holyhead
Plenty of services and traffic. Got offered a ride to Dolgellau but they decided to go a bit further and dropped me off in Machynlleth
Nice and quick ride with total gigachad. Again just thumbing the road. Lots of sports car driving twats gawping at me from behind their raybans but got a ride quickly!
Fiest car stopped! Kindly tourists taking me a little further down the road. Just thumbing directly on the road.
Just wandering the road with thumb, got a quick ride to the junction with a kind local.
Glorious place to hitchhike after getting off the ferry, 3 cars stopped at once, people were nearly fighting over me!
decent place to get to the ferry in Gills bay, cars can stop farely easily
got picked up by my favorite driver ever, he gave me a very well informed tour of the highlands on the way, shown me moniments and reccomended me poets to read on the way!
Not much traffic but found it very easy to get rides to and from Suardalan Bothy along the old military road (that what it’s called on google maps)
There is a perfect place for cars to pull into w/ the bus stop. Even at close to 10PM it was only a little while before a bloke took me all the way to Glasgow.
Holy grail of spots going out of isle of Skye
The entire A855 is very easy to hitchhike north/south on.
Good spot with space for cars go stop..got a ride straight to Glasgow within 20mn
A little bit of a fast road but somebody did stop and took me to A66 which was a first step to exit the Lakes

I was quite lucky to find a ride which took me all the was to Lancaster. However it's a good spot with lots of space for cars to see you and then stop. Not very busy though. I was there on a Monday morning at about 10:30
Good spot to get to Dunbar if you’re coming from the castle
Second people we talked to gave us a lift to Yorkshire! Good spot with a lot of traffic
Quickly found a ride into southwest London from here
good spot as there is a lot of space to pull in for driver and they see aou quite some time before, I was hitching with a bike and just waiting 15 minutes

near the parking exit traffic light will be a good places find the car to goe hitchhike, but nowadays not everyone known it , hoping everything goes well, i find the paper board from the supermarket 1km away from airport
very polite
Got lucky and found a lift on to the A2/M2 really quickly. Went to Faversham.

Perfect spot to head any direction as it's the crossroads of the Highlands. 
Drivers can see you from a good distance and go around the roundabout very slowly. Lift to Glasgow within 5 minutes.
This road is deserted, nobody comes here, bit for some reason a crammed car of tourists happily picked me up and took me to the main road. What gigachad's. Don't count on it though.

Taking the train to Taffs Well and walking a few minutes gives access to this roundabout, which is not perfect but people were not driving fast and there were construction works which created good spots to stop.

There's a bus stop and people are driving slowly through the town, much better spot than further on the road where people are just driving too quickly.
And you can also take the bus to bath.
There's plenty of space to stop, traffic is going reasonably slow
Lots of cars going past at slow speeds. Good spot

On the corran Ferry (which is free for foot passengers) go to the front, and ask the ferry workers if you can get off first to hitchike. Run up the ramp onto land and stick your thumb out, have your stuff ready to get into the drivers car first. has worked repeatedly getting me to fort william.
Walking along the street straight off the ferry. Nearly Dark. Stick thumb out at car randomly in the middle of the street and get a lift to the other end of the island!

I've tried this spot twice and both times been picked up in around 20-30 minutes. You have traffic coming from two directions with a good spot for them to pull in (bus stop). Lots of people heading to join the M1 going south on this road.
Good spot, touristic site so a lot of cars. Enough room to stop
Good spot, we got a car from the ferry. Bus layout and car park so easy for cars to stop too
We managed to get a ride to Glasgow from someone who was in the ferry with us.
1 car stopped for us, thumb out
It felt like the middle of nowhere but luckily only after something like a minute I got a ride. I suppose a lot of traffic coming this way is going East to or through Petersfield
Quite a good spot as people can see you far in advance and decide, quietish at least when I was there so though no parking laybays a person could stop if there's not people right behind them
Hardly even began waiting and then got a ride. It's good as cars can first see you very far away so they have time to decide to pick you up
It was a good spot, but needs to be low enough traffic so the car can easily park at the side of the road without cars right behind them
I got lucky probably, but I think it's a reasonably good spot. It was quietish at the time (3pm or so) making it a bit easier for someone to stop too.
Walk along the road out of Ullapool until you find an area with decent pavement and a bus stop. Good spot, got a ride to durness in 2 minutes

I hitch very often early in the morning going for  work. Usually takes one car to reach directly to Fort William, cos most locals which are very friendly, go there. That applies in the winter, but waiting time can take longer (5-30 min), cos not much traffic during this time per year. In a summer, traffic is very busy (takes less time to catch a car)
Picked up by someone on the same flight as me. Good chat and rugged views of the city.
Great spot to hitch towards Glastonbury and Pilton

Just outside the terminal, next to the parking lot. The cars were still disembarking when I walked out. They come one by one, well spaced apart. Plenty of space for them to stop aswell. 

Probable even better to ask people onboard the night before, if that's your style.

I've used this spot twice, both on a Saturday morning. You can very easily catch a ride to Burtonwood services from here, or all the way to Liverpool or Manchester. Recommend a sign saying M62, and either Liverpool or Manchester, but if you're going to Manchester and get offered a right to Burtonwood services take it, you can get to Manchester quite easily from there.
Easy to get lifts from other hikers here, second person I tried stopped
Got a lift to Caernarfon after 10 minutes, spot was easy to get to from Llanfairpwllgwyngyll. Cars aren't going that fast and there's space to pull in
I was lucky and a car stoped and took me to Perth ! I think it's a good place to HH to the south cars has space for parking
It's a complicated spot for HH because the cars have space to edge one side... Very important to have a Sing !!!, I wait just 7 minutes with a sing to Edinburgh.
A good spot to go to Brecon or North ⬆️
Vehicles are fast moving, but otherwise a good spot. Virtually everybody will be going as far as Appleby or Penrith at a minimum

Past the roundabout in the direction of Cardiff there's a great shady wide spot where cars can pull over. Before we even got there someone saw us walking and pulled over and waited for us. Took us to carmarthen, was going farther north.
very  friendly  locals  give  lifts  on  B3227  due  to  infrequent  bus  services   East  to  Taunton  and  West  to  the  Devon  border
Good spot, got a car quite quickly. It seems like you can go to north, south-west or south from here
Got a ride pretty much instantly
Got a ride within 30 minutes in the morning
Pretty god spot, easy to stop for drivers
Nice easy spot to catch a ride to Llandelio, wait by the pub called Salutions inn
The second driver that i asked gave me a lift to Glasgow. There is enough traffic at the petrol station. Good spot to find somebody to Glasgow.

Seemed like a bad spot, but the second car pulled over and took me to the Cairngorms! They may be able to mount the curb on the bridge or tuck into the little hill track entrance. Good visibility and friendly locals.

very quick. lots of traffic moving slow on this roundabout. had camped the night up on a footpath at the top of the hill that this sideroad leads to.
lift from Peter
Very good spot for going direction north

The two of were Hithching to Gleoncoe and got a ride in 15 minutes by a Audi quattro convertible. The guy was driving through the glen 100 mph and we had a sunny day! It was the best drive of my life. :D 
We got here for free because of the friendly employees at the Queen street railway station in Glasgow!

I was hitching to Fort William and got a lift within 10 mins on a Monday afternoon at 3.30pm to Tyndrum. Lots of traffic at this time and the cars have to slow down for the roundabout. There is plenty of room for cars to pull into the turnoff to the left so that you can get in.

This roundabout is a bit chaotic, but you'll get somebody to pull in where the marker is. If you are several people, take strategical positions, so cars coming from the south and the east can see you a bit earlier.

We actually took time to find the good spot and this one was not bad, but not the best..
All the cars go to the M1, but drive quite fast/small place to park next to the garage. Good luck !
10 minutes direct ride to leeds...  seems little bit dodgy.. maybe dangerous and difficult to get there.. good luck.
Good place to pull in and traffic slows/stops next to due to traffic lights
Got ride almost instantly on 2 occasions
Had to wait 10 minutes. Got a ride half way to Edinburgh.
Reliable as allways
Once again a sub 10m hitch
Great spot towards Aberfeldy. Turn in for farm and campsite
We were heading to Uig and all we got was a ride to Broadford, but considering it was pouring rain we were quite lucky after only a 10min wait.  (July 2019)

on the bridge entering the isle
got away in 30 minutes by family all the way up to uig
this was in 2003
15 minute wait for a ride and tour around glasgow
We waited 5 min to get a lift to glasgow directly. A lot of cars and a place to stop after the roundabout.
Me and my friend got a ride within 2 hours at 3am.
Heading south, cars going slow, if you stand just before the railing they can stop in the bus stop.
ride from Catherine
The road has a slow speed limit, which makes it easier for cars to see you and stop by
I got a direct ride!
to Fort William
Lots of traiffic, space to pull over, a few rude people
Cars will struggle to see you at night
Just walk along the pavement road if you're heading south, people pull in on the pavement, seems like a bad spot but the watiting times have been tiny multiple times.
Great spot, good opportunity for drivers to stop in the driveway, catching most traffic leaving for William. Lots of destinations here (Oban, Glasgow,...)
not the best, but not a busy road so a lot of drivers just stop on the road. 3 successful hitches from this spot
hitched here many times, great place

Everyone I spoke to was going North so it was really tricky. I waited by the exit but it wasn’t busy enough for the cars to be stopped so no one pulled over. Tried the same at the exit of the car park with no luck. I approached people at the benches by the food hall and most were going North, or there was one just not interested in giving a lift! Of those who were going North they were very lovely and wished me the best of luck getting to my destination and said they would have been happy to hel
Asking around with a sign in hand and got a lift into Newcastle in no time at all. Very good spot!

Got a lift here direct to Heathrow (London) in 5 minutes by a woman who wouldn't normally pick up hitch hikers. If there are lots of cars then there is a traffic jam and lots of time for people to think about taking you.
Got a lift here quite quickly heading South.

June 2025 Trying to get west on M40. This has all the makings of a great spot but way too many people making short trips. I had 6 cars pull over and ask where I was going but all were either just local or headed to the M25. I ended up giving up and going to the train station
Very good spot for getting out of London
waited there less, than 5 min. stayed after exit from gas station. good point, good traffic. you can check both traffic from gas station and from mcdonalds

[NORTHBOUND ENTRANCE LAYBY ON A40]
[A40 -> M40 NORTH]

This is a good strategic location, all the traffic from the A312 joins the A40 northbound here and there is a layby on the sliproad so traffic can stop. It took a matter of seconds to find a hitch going to Birmingham from here. 

There is a Texaco petrol station on this side of the roundabout and a McDonald's. The attendant in Texaco was happy for me to hitch from the petrol station itself.

Several buses connect the roundabout with Hounslow

Hello yeah!

Good lay by, good visibility, got a ride all the way to tongue really quick!
If you get a ride to the roundabout from inverness it's best to walk up the hill to this parking, you shouldn't have to wait too long.
Very good spot. Pretty easy walk from the tube. Got a ride near Sheffield quickly on a Sunday morning.

Staples corner: good spot for going north up the M1. Used this as a starting point for a London - Lake District trip. Short wait with sign 'North' + thumb, standing just before the mechanics that drivers can pull into before getting on the motorway.
another place to get onto the m1 north - there's a traffic light there. 2 guys got away in about 15 minutes, after dark.
Much faster this time. Before I even got there I got a ride
Suprisingly long to get a lift but the roads are dead this time of year!
Back again. Nearly an instant with a sign. Shoutout Smellington Piff, stream him wherever you get your music

Decent spot for traffic to see you. The split in the road can give cars a spot to stop but might cause some traffic and angry honks. Best to have a sign as the highway splits north and east further up
The gift that keeps on giving
Great spot if for some reason your out here. Got a ride to Perth in a oner
It was a long wait here. It is a nice spot though. Access to services and other positive aspects. Shaded by trees.
Someone told me I wouldn’t get a ride here, but she was wrong! Best blackberries of my summer right by this bus stop. Great visibility and place to stop.
Great spot, cafe, toilets etc, plnety of traffic in different directions

Great place to hitch from! Wait at the exit of the carpark/public toilets - cars can see you from the corner and there is plenty of space for them to pull in to the bus stop to pick you up. Also there's a Londis shop just round the corner for snacks!
tried to get to lock Lomond however the lady who picked us up left us in the wrong place.

Easy ride, if I need to reach Glasgow/Edinburgh or even further down to England (sometimes lucky to reach destination by only one car). Or stand on opposite side of the road, if heading to Oban/Fort William.
Good opportunities to stop in the bus parking area, locals friendly. Lots of traffic.
asked around the truck drivers. dude took me to rotherham. ideal spot
(28F) Super easy. Waited by the station exit and spoke to people as they stopped to exit. Ended up getting a lift with a delivery driver that does long distance deliveries.

No need to ask for a ride, as the cars pull out they are going very slow and have time to pull over in a large area to the side. I was there on a Sunday morning before a bank holiday Monday so traffic was very light. I imagine normally there are many more cars.
the british people seem to not accept many hitchhikers on their ride. I asked some people and they were rude sometimes, so I just stayed at the corner waiting for a ride. Took me more than 30 min

Gas station with a restaurant and place to sleep (I think). Good place for hitchhiking: slow cars, good traffic and place to park, eat something. The problem is that the british people doesn't seem to be friendly with hitchhikers when asking them for a ride.

Pretty good spot
cars are not going too fast and there is space to stop on the bus stop 
Had a sign with name of the city where I wanted to go.

Hitched here end of March 2017 11am. Waited before bus stop. Waited 20 min with sign saying "M4 Bristol"
Many cars which have to wait at traffic lights and can pull over in the lay-by.
Hitch from here in April 2015, spot is perfect, lots of traffic and space to stop on the bus stop, got unlucky though and waited 3h
Waited about 1.5 hours here and got a ride in August 2010.  Wait JUST before the bus stop, and if someone stops they can pull right in.

I've stopped here twice while hitchhiking south from Scotland to London. First time got a ride to Birmingham, and the second time to London. Both pretty quickly. Plus the services are comfortable, with free toilets, charging sockets etc. I would definitely stop here again when looking for a longer-distance ride.
We sat outside the building, eating lunch, with a sign.
Service station with quite nice pond.
I waited just up the road by the bus stop (number 6 if you are moving through York like I was)
I used the layby/bus stop up the road, waiting for about 30 - 45 mins, i would say the layby is better than garage.
I stand either outside of the petrol station (the one with the Daleks on it), or just near the bus stop slightly further along the road when heading East. Usually get a lift within ten minutes.

Not the best place to hitchhike but a good spot to go to Skye's Island : cars are going fast but there is a small room at the insertion path to Elean Donan Castle. If the spot doesn't work, you can ask at the parking !
If you feel like talking to lots of scared tourists, asking around the parking lot of Eilean Donan Castle might be worth the effort.
Very good spot there ! A lot of room for drivers, slow traffic but people are lovely and stop to ask where you're going ;)
Good spot to head to the Isle of Skye, got there in one ride, lots of tourists.
Good ride but not far.. Theme for the day

There is a busstop just after the street turned into a "highway". First thereÂ´s a parking spot and right after that the busstop. Easy to thumb a ride towards Inverness and generally north of Scotland!Take bus  27 to get there. 17 and 21 get you close to it!
Super fast, first car!
Only lay-by along the road from ballaculish going west
perfect for Oban

(28F) The woman in the station said it was a bit of a rough area to be asking for lifts but I found people to be very friendly even if they couldn’t take me. I eventually got someone to drop me at Washington Services as I was heading south on the A1 and assumed it would be busier and easier there which it was.

This is a gas station where you could stay close to the entrance. There is a big place for cars to park. Sometimes they passes a little too fast but there are many cars passing by. The owner of the gas station told me that 2 people tried to hitchhike there. A girl asked for people and she got a ride but the guy didn't make it.
in the sottish rain everything becomes average...
We were on our way to Thurso, walked up about 30 meters from where the fork in the road was.

Going north over the Forth Road bridge

not the nicest spot to wait, but decent traffic and enough space for people to stop.

Going to Edinburgh - walk up the road and get the local bus for Â£1.80 - need exact change
Got dropped off about an hours walk from here so walked over and got a ride within 5 minutes towards bristol
got   a lift promptly to  Bristol  at   03-00 in the  morning  after  walking  1 mile  along the motorway to get  to the  servies
Leigh Delamere Services, M4 towards Bristol, Cardiff. Good for rides into Wales.
Great spot in front of the gas station, drivers can spot you well and stop easily.
Cars are slow so easy for them to spot you. Not really ideal to stop on the side for the car but we still managed to get a ride within 10 minutes

Good spot for hitching towards Inverness, cars see you from afar and have space to stop. Also good spot to hitchike after the sun has fallen because it is well lit.

Bonus: friendly neighbor who came out to greet us and made a sign for us :)
Got a ride in 5 minutes, we were really lucky. Spot is not ideal, not really any room for the car to pull over near you but the intersection of cars makes them go slower.
Great place to hitchhike towards Inverness. You can stand with a sign on the corner so you get the cars from both roads and there is enough of space for the cars to stop.
Very busy, asked around in the Service Station for a while and then stood at the exit with a sign. Got a ride just South of London after less than an hour
Got a lift all the way to East London from a trucker here. (Trucks round the back of the station) ALSO: brambles and cherries to be found in the shrubbery surrounding - yum!
Good for heading North or South on the A1. Not that much traffic through this services but it's the safest spot. Average wait about an hour
Hitched from here in early July 2019, this is a pretty good spot! There's some space for the cars to pull over too. We were headed to Kyleakin, Skye and the driver left us right there! 15-20min wait.

Not a conventional spot but it will get you to Mallaig or Inverness.
Cars can stop on the crossroad with the smaller road.
It took a long time to get a ride but people around me were super helpful and in the end I got a great ride to Eastbourne
We were dropped here by our previous ride. He used to be an hitchiker and told us this was the best spot to go to Brighton. In less than 10 minutes we got a ride.
Brilliant spot - did it on a Wednesday in November on a clear day, stood by the tree trunk outside the petrol station - got a lift to Kingston in about 11 mins, just with a thumb.

Me and a friend waited only 15mins at around 7:30am and got a lift going to London. We stood just before the petrol station. It worked well as people are slowing down because of the lights and can pull in to the petrol station easily if they want to pick you up. Staff also let us use the toilet there.

After maybe 15 minutes we got a ride. The driver stopped in the gas station and we're in. It was maybe 4.30 in the evening and there was already some traffic. When the light was red a little traffic jam obliged the drivers to stop the car and ultimately stare at us, which was kind of funny if you're confortable with it.
Great spot, lots of traffic in summer

(July 2019), we waited here for 5-10min tops, it's a really good spot to hitch as there's a lot of room for cars to stop! The drivers were kind enough to drop us off at a train station really close to Edimburgh, which was were we were heading.
Hitching to Fort William, there is plenty of room to stand outside the hotel, with cars able to see you from a way away, and plenty of room to pull in.
Took the bus 6a from the centre to the petrol station. Asked around to people and the first lady we asked took us to Loch Lomond our destination
It was early july last year and we managed to get a ride to Milton (after a 20min wait)  which was an even better spot to find a ride to Fort William!

If you're taking the 6 or 6a bus, DO NOT get off here, it goes much further to better spots. If you're walking from Kelvingrove or the west end this is an acceptable spot to reach for free. There isn't a perfect place to stand as there are guard rails blocking you from the view of cars, so you must wait next to the petrol station and the car must pull into the petrol station to pick you up. Only got a ride to Dumbarton, but it's better than waiting here!

Petrol station on the main road to Fort William. 20-30 minutes walk from Kelvingrove. We (one guy one girl) accepted a ride to Erskine after 20 minutes. Longer rides must be possible, but even just Erskine is a good start; better than waiting in Glasgow! When you leave Glasgow, you will find that the A82 has many good spots to wait.
Hitchhiking north on M5

Was headed west to Pembrokeshire , stood by the entrance to the patrol station and got picked up quickly by someone coming out the petrol station who was going camping in the breacon beacons . A really great spot, thanks hitchmap!
Got a lift within 3mn for the M5 going north. Probably quite lucky but it's a good spot just before the motorway
I good spot for hitchhike to Wales, I had a sing with Wales. Just in the exit of the gas station. They took me to Newport where I wanted to go.
stood at the exit of the petrol station so I could ask the drivers exiting and still show my sign to passing by cars that are not too fast because of the traffic light before.
I pass through here a lot when going to stoke-on-trent and ask for a lift to manchester, it never takes long

The spot outside the petrol station is excellent, as cars are slow, abundant, and there is ample room to pull over.
The service station offers refreshments and toilets.
Asked around for a lift going North. Not long before someone could take us to Weatherby Services.

Vast majority of cars heading north but decent spot at the exit of the Texaco

Free toilet insid the texaco
English people seem to be really afraid of hitchhikers, however it's a good spot to go and speak with drivers. Got a lift after 2h11min
I got a ride towards Manchester from here on a Sunday morning.
took ~2 hours to get a lift. Still it is probably the best place to catch a car going south from Edi
best place to head south from edinburgh!
Hitched out twice here very easily. Both times going long distances (Worchester and Stoke-on-trent).

Yep, the garage is the last decent spot for miles. I found out the hard way and walked about 4 miles down the narrow road before finding another wide bit where someone could pick me up. There's a city bus that stops here, so it's not hard to get to from Edinburgh.

Biiiig layby! Good visibility, semi slow traffic. Good for going north. Lots of cars but as a two lane highway half of them can't stop for you. after 15 mins I was offered a ride to tore which is the crossroads of the Highlands a 10 mins up the road. I should have taken it if heading north as there is a good laybye beyond the roundabout. I foolishly rejected and waited 45 mins for the next offer of tore. Just after the first car left a camper pulled up right behind me, and with a look of horror
well worth the walk out of town
not coned off anymore.

Best spot for hitching north from inverness. Cars are going slow and you shouldn't be waiting any longer than 20 mins to half an hour. HOWEVER until June 2013 roadworkers have coned off this layby meaning you have to cross the bridge to find a decent spot
Car arrives from the roundabout so usually not too fast, and there's a huge laybay for them to stop. Great for going north. I waited less than 10 minutes

We got off the car that dropped us to Tarbet and 2 seconds after we got another car to Glencoe. Spot is great cause there's a small car park for the hotel behind, so because of the intersection people are going slow and they can also pull over at the car park
I actually thought it wasn't a good spot as there is only a small space to pull over, but got a ride within 5 minutes. I think I was lucky as I could imagine waiting here for over an hour easily.
good spot, hard to get a ride though
We waited 1 hour to get a ride north, but I think we were unlucky. It felt like quite a good spot.

Stood at the entrance to the petrol station and got a lift heading into London. Also got offered a lift to Milton Keynes inside the services when seen walking around with sign. Not loads of traffic but decent spot
Stood by the BP petrol station, took about 30 minutes to get a lift towards Oxford on the A43.
Within 5 mins of getting dropped off I got a ride to london.

Waited about 20 mins until a trucker gave me a ride about 20 miles south.
people were very friendly!
If you buy something/are kind enough then the McDonald's in the services may give you a free cup with ice, invaluable if it is a hot day.
People usually go north from here as it seems, but got lucky with a young German guy going right to Edinburgh
Reliable as allways but perhaps a slightly lucky time
Great spot good traffic flow and cars move slow.
Yep. You'll find people going to Perth, Inverness, Edinburgh, Dundee, and even Glasgow.

Great place to hitch to the Isle of Skye. Most cars are going that way and a lot of them are tourists which in my experience are more willing to pick you up. It is a bus stop so there's plenty of room for the cars to stop.
Good spot to get towards Ft. William or maybe Inverness.
Medium petrol station, decent spot to get out of London. I got a lorry to Swindon early morning.
most of people leaving gasstation asked us where were going, very good spot. just stand behind the gasstation.
Had a lot of problems finding somebody going south on the M25, but M4 seems to be easy. Was surprised by the lack of traffic.

Very good place, not so much traffic, but easy to catch someone on a road going to Bristol. Have been catching for almost 15 minutes.

Near H28 and 111 bus stops and quite far away from Hounslow West metro station from Picadilly Line.
superb hitching point (service area) for bristol, birmingham etc.
First we tried for 2.5 hours to get to southampton. Nobody heading that direction. Lots of people heading to brighton or bristol.
After 1 hour of waiting at the eastbound exit with a "M1" sign two cars stopped at the same time: one going to Luton and another to Sheffield.
Stood at the eastbound extrance with a sign "Dover" and got a lift to Maidstone Services within 10 min.

stood here 1 1/2 h under the roof of the gasstation, moved to the extrance M3 and was taken to a nice old couple going for Southampton. they made a detour on the a303, because I was going for stonehenge
the put me of at A30XA303
Not really a good spot but there's enough space on the low sidewalk for a car to stop.
Not really a good place cause the traffic here has 2 lanes but got lucky to be picked up in less then 5min with a sign saying BOX/M4
Good place, been there for 30 minutes, then a lorry pick me up. Also there is a chance that somebody will pick you up and drive you to roundabout from which you can enter M4.
Hard shoulder before the roundabout should be the best place to get out of the city.

Two people stopped to ask where I was going but after only 10 minutes I got asked to move by the police because it’s not a good place for cars to stop, I moved to the entrance to mcdonalds/the petrol station and got a lift within 5 minutes
Very quick, everyone goes north, only find person who takes you
Best spot to hitchhike out of Gatwick towards London probably since everyone coming out of the station this way has to stop. Got a ride north after 40 mins.
Didnt even make it to a good spot! car stopped in the road for me :D
towards Glasgow, best place is just downhill from the filling station.
Hitched many times from here to Fort William. Usually 5-10 minutes wait.
Best spot to hitch out of inverness heading southwest. Not very much room for cars to pull in, but traffic is still going slowly at the exit to the golf club.
Good space to pull over, excellent visability, but traffic diverges just a little further up meaning that your might have to turn down lifts
We waited around 1 hour because there were three of us.
A bus stop on the way out of the town.
Lots of cars stopped but most were going to Birmingham or up the M6. I was hoping to get onto the M1 but gave up and went up the M6

A good spot for hitching up the M1 north or across the M42. Stood here 20 minutes, got a nice lift all the way to Nottingham. It took me a minute to figure out the right spot but I opted for the place where cars are coming out of the car park, pausing before turning right towards exit / filling station. You get a good flow of traffic and they are nice and slow, with space to pull in.
A bit tricky to scramble up the bank onto the road, especially with luggage, and essentially just a hard shoulder to stop on, but had success within 25 minutes

Not the best pull off spot for cars, often travelling at speed and seeing you late as they tun off the roundabout. Saying that someone stopped for me within 20 mins.

Recommend holding an 'M11' sign.

Direction M11 / London Stansted Airport

High visibility, a lot of cars (a sign saying "North" or "M11" is still very useful).
I had no luck here so moved to before the smaller roundabout and found lift quickly

Exellent for Inverness and north. Most of the local trafic to airport and Dyce industrial area has turned. A sign is helpfull as well. Stagecoach buses will take here for Â£1.70 bit pricy but worth it
Very good spot to go West. There is a good place for cars to stop and very good visibility.
There's not enough place to stop legally but plenty enough on the road marking in the center, we got lucky and only waited a quarter hour
That's where I start hitching after visiting Stonehenge, not a really a good spot, no place to stop for the car but the road is large enough, got very lucky and got a lift within 2min
Room enough for cars to stop. Good spot to hitchhike to Loch Ness after finishing the Wet Highland Way!
Felt like the cars drive quite fast but it worked for me in direction london in leds than 10 min.

A reasonable spot for hitch-hiking towards London. There is plenty of space for cars to stop, safe piece of sidewalk for a hitch-hiker and lots of traffic going directly to London this way. 

See google street view here: http://bit.ly/16vbP5Y

I had to wait for around 90 minutes on late Sunday afternoon.
ride from Derek
easy lifts to green welly or further towards highlands from here it seems. good place to stand.
I used to use this spot regularly, there is a bus stop either side. I never waited too long either.
Bus stop at end of town, just after petrol station.
pull in just after roundabout heading towards Kinlochewe
Friendly locals :)
Got a ride with a worker from the nuclear plant... Found out some things I'd rather not know about the nuclear waste management there and quality of the seawaters..
Pretty area :)
Got a ride pretty quick towards the northern side of the island :)
It's an easy area to hitchhike in.
Usually when I'm heading from Fort William towards Glenfinnan, I walk to this bus stop in Banavie. I've never had problems hitching here.
I had bad luck hitching at the services, so I tried the hotel. Not great, but I got a long ride to Glasgow. So a win.
Litterally the first car, shame it wasnt far though!
Lots of traffic going onto the motorway. Cars are going fast but there is a long stretch for them to stop
Lots of traffic. Not much space to stop. Lucky the Cornish are bloody lovely people

Great for traffic going to the A30.
Cars will have to pull into the grass though
Low traffic. But likely heading to Oxford. Got a lift from the first car I saw after walking here from the Folly
Most traffic should be heading west. A road right there for a car to pull into. There’s street parking which would be a better stopping option but it was full
Fairly easy, good visability, but earlier laybys towards lix toll if you need them that would be just as good and a much shorter walk
Nice spot to catch a ride south. Got lucky they were going all the way to Edinburgh
Good ride, cheap coffee and if you get really stuck, a car park to ask around in. The coffee is good too!
Good area to pull off, and lots of visability! Great for the final streach into oban, and the train station is right there if you dont make it! Got a lift from a mountaineering couple.
Most traffic is local, expect to get only as far as Stroud
Plenty of cars slowly making their way past right before hitting the motorway. Great for northbound travel. Not the perfect spot if you’re going east to the Cotswolds but I got lucky
A bit of space for cars to stop but plenty of opportunity for them to see you. Many roads further up though, plenty of offers for short lifts or towns you’re not going to
Not the best place in terms of having space for cars to stop, but the kind Irish people never disappoint. For direction A5 (Strabane, Omagh, Dublin)
Ride with a delivery driver.

Found for Manchester, lot of people don't stop but be patient and you will find a car.
Ride until Manchester
got stuck here overnight due to bad luck, workers were lovely and let me nap, got a ride down eventually
Got lucky pretty late in the day - a couple took me to Aberdeen. It is the entrance to the road there... so it doesn't seem like there are better spots around. Good visibility, low speeds etc
A decent spot. Try to get tourists that will get back to the main road, because this place is the middle of nowhere. Nice friendly sheep around.
Everywhere on Uist is half deserted. Maybe you get lucky. Maybe you don't. If you walk, the beaches are nice :) The wind's a bit rough though.
Held a sign. Got a ride to Glasgow within half an hour or so
Good spot/only one way to Perth's direction/a small insertion path to park. 20 min wait.

Decent place to hitch towards Fort William. Right at the exit from the roundabout so cars are going slow. The downside is that it is right before a bridge which seemed to make the drivers nervous and less willing to stop even though there is a little road before the bridge when they can pull over.

Bus stop with lots of space to pull in. Was picked up by second car that passed. 
Quieter road but plenty of traffic especially in summer.
Hitching South would have been faster. Hitched with sign at the exit of petrol station. Asking would have been faster but I'm awkward
By bus stop, you may get a lift if someone takes pity otherwise there is the bus. Cars pull into the car wash and may also help
Fast pick up but again local lift.
Good spot but man it took forever to hitch
Good spot with space to stop but very local traffic
Great spot at the end of the pavement on the outbound side of the road
Fantastic spot! Great traffic flow on a Saturday. Bring a sign because traffic could be going a lot of different directions.
Good Spot with a great cafe and bus shelter if its wet!

started walking with thumb out and little hope towards Torrin but got picked up by the second car.
Ride from Robert
Ride from Harriet & Rick

decent amount of traffic at all hours of the day i imagine. pretty much everyone going to the same places aswell.
Ride from Paul

wasn't loads of traffic but the lift i did get took me all the way to skye up incredibly beautiful roads.
Ride from Jake & Adrian

instant lift a decent way up north on my way to Skye.
lift from Chloe & Ben

good layby, lots of traffic heading towards fort william/skye/highlands it seems.
lift from James

Tried to get from here to Belgium as I've heard of people being stranded further down at Folkestone/Dover. Am aware that channel crossings are challenging so I won't let my ambitious targets hurt the rating of this spot.

Was offered a ride once every hour but none of them were to Belgium or even across the channel.

5 hours in I decided any car that could take me further along the M20 would work, and got a ride to Dover 5 minutes later.

I put an extra pin here as this spot worked much be

asked around at this petrol station and the 2nd person agreed even though they were in a rush.
lift from Tom

steady flow of traffic while i was there. car pulled over on side of the road, not even in the sideroad where i was expecting. good lift to get to A1.
ride from Sabby
Someone told me I couldn’t get a ride here, but they were wrong! Good visibility and place to stop. Best blackberries of my summer right by this bus stop.
If you somehow manage to get here, there is a bus lane with excellent visibility & space to stop + traffic is going very slow due to the red light. Access road for M4
A really good spot with most of the people going to either Manchester or Liverpool, we prolly just weren't that lucky :D
There was a construction traffic light here so it was easy to have cars slow down.
A bit of a walk out of Blairgowrie. Cars go a bit fast but could easily stop
I asked people with irish number plates at the car park of lidl wether they go to Donegal. I got a ride to Buncrana with the first person I talked to
Great spot at a bus stop. Visibility is not the best, but okay.

Spot is next to the M1 and there is a hotel nearby to freshen up. But there is a lot of local traffic. Going south, the cars were in the inner lane. I got lucky, and don't think my experience would reflect how challenging it normally would be.

The best spot at this juncture is where the road turns and there is a large place to pull off to narrow road. The woman we rode with went out of her way to help us, saying she saw us before, and was happy to see us a second time when she was able. She drove us further because she thought our chances were not good to catch another ride through this beautiful, sparsely populated countryside.
People are going kind of fast, and there is not the best place to pull out. The man we caught was going to Fishguard, so we got out shortly to catch another ride on the road in direction Cardigan.

June 2025 - M40 west. After giving up on a spot in London I went here. About 30 mins walk from the train station, you have to smash down some brambles and it is a slipway so technically not legal, but it took no time at all and I actually got all the way to my destination in the Cotswolds
There is nice stop for car, but there are lot of tourist serching for  parking spot, so many cars just pass by
Got a lift to Crianlarich from here from a van driver, good spot can go in either direction, traffic moving slow round the bend
at  times  ,  extremely  busy  with  speeding  traffic and narrow sliproad  down omto  M5 North
Plenty of places to stop in Long preston, got a lift heading East from the bus stop
Plenty of space to stop in long layby as cars climb hill, slightly hidden from view by sign but plenty of traffic heading east in Leeds direction
Hitched at night. This spot can be pretty good in theory as you have plenty of traffic flow , but at night it can take quite some time
Not much around here, but there is space for cars to stop and you might get lucky. My driver initially passed me by, but then came back minutes later and took me all the way to Fishguard
Not ideal, but this roundabout or the gas station is definitely the best spot to get South
many people going to thurso altho its hard to pull over here
got picked up a very nice pair of travelers, i dont recomend that stop going north, its very hard for cars to stop safely
Got a lift to nearby Gunton. Had no sign and had several people stop and ask before this.
Good spot, but cars go fast and seem reluctant.
Second step to exit the Lakes. Very fast road but there's lots a space for cars to stop and a good visibility so with some luck somebody will stop. Took me closer to the M6
Lots of coachs so hard to pick out drivers. Lots of people going south. But still good if going towards north
Was there on a Sunday morning. Not a lot of cars but manage after a while. There's space for them to stop though and they are coming quite slow so you should manage too
Good spot. Cars can stop easily. Was there on a Monday lunch time
Got around the M25 by asking people at the pumps whether they were going clockwise.
Got a ride into Gloucester waiting at the bus stop, lots of cars but can get awkward when the bus turns up
Great spot to head South. Low speed limit and drivers can pull over at the intersection. Lift south within 10 minutes
More room to stop at the bus stop east but got a lift from the Hermitage driveway after 40 minutes back and forth
Never hard heading towards Aberdeen. Fast roads. Too many dual carriageways.
Male, 4 seats available, 10 minute drive. Locations approximate
Male, 2 seats available, 20 minute drive
not the best spot, the road widens out a fair bit and theres enough space for cars to pull over, good interaction with drivers, got a to bristol
Nearby the Italian Church. Good place to stop.
Bus Stop that's good for hitchhiking.
Good sight and place to stop.
Place for cars to stop and you get all the traffic from town and the ferry. Lidl with toilet nearby.
Waited at the entrance/exit of the petrol station for about an hour and a half with a sign till I got a lift to Chippenham. Lots of smiles and hellos from people as I waited :)
High number of cars going past at slow speeds.
Good tunes
Lots of trafic and tourists in the gas station. Easy to go to Kyle and further.

Great experience for us on the bus stop just after the sign, going south. Cars can be fast but have the time to see you, and then stop on the bus stop right behind. May be difficult to deal with if your alone as the bus stop is in the corner.
Great spot ! Quite a lot of car are exiting the station, with low speed. Better having a sign to know if you to go Leceister or Birmingham
Great spot as the trafic light let you time to eye contact the drivers. Perfect to go North/Birmingham. Car can stop along the road.

We spent a long time in the gas station speaking with people, but everyone was going to London, so when it stopped raining we crossed the road and got a car to Luton. 
The M&S crew is lovely and can help you
Tried at the petrol station but didn't seem to be as much traffic so we moved to the main services and got a lfit to Romford very quickly
Not ideal because on the highway so cars are going fast but they can still see you from afar and stop on the layout
Bit dangerous on the highway but we stood on the parking layout and we managed to get a car within 15 minutes
Someone else dropped us here. Not ideal to get back on the high way but someone nicely brought us back on it
Cars are a bit fast but there's a layout there where they can stop.
Good spot, there's a car park and a lot of space for people to stop. The only cars you get though are the people leaving from the campsite.
A campervan stopped and offered us a lift. Good stop for HH cause of the car park
Good visibility coming out of Sennybridge. I had a sign saying "Llandovery" and regularly use this spot.
At the exit of the Sainsbury and Petrol station towards the big roundabout to go M5 north

The spot always works - there's traffic lights to slow cars down and bus stand for them to stop. I hitched couple of times from here, although need to ignore many grumpy city people passing through. Disadvantage that is far away from city center (I walked, but, of course, you can take a city bus)

I got off at the inter-city bus station and this spot was not far away from there. I was heading to Norfolk and was probably lucky. Not an idyll spot, not much traffic in the early morning, but there's space for cars to stop up the hill.
Most chances when going to the East (North or South)

Slower traffic coming uphill
Big layby

Lots of traffic
Petrol Station opposite
Big layby
Traffic fairly slow after roundabout

Got a lift to Porthmadog here quite quickly (rain might have helped) although bit of a pain to get to, I walked along Rhedyw Rd from Llanllyfni then climbed down to this layby from the bridge over the A road.
Good spot to stand and people can stop on the bus stop. but not that many cars go to Cambridge
Not many cars, but friendly, and you can talk to drivers. Got ride to swansea
After the roundabout direction cardiff. Cars start picking up speed but still many slow enough. In front of some houses small place to stop
long bus  stop   layby  gives  easy  rides  to  Ilminster  or  beyond (  onto  A303  )
CONVENIENT   LAYBY  /  bus  stop    for  Westbound  to  Wiveliscombe  and  Dulverton
There's a bus stop and the road is on a downhill so the drivers can see you from afar. I hitchhiked here early in the morning, so wait time should be lower with more traffic.
It’s a good one, but narrow place near the road

The spot is not the best, but the cars can pull on the side to the island with the pedestrian crossing. I was hitchhiking to Central London with a sign "London A40" people stop there at the traffic lights so they have enough time to see you. All traffic goes in the direction of Central London. So pretty good, 4/5 because for hitchhiker it's not the top spot but there is no better at this place. It's safe when you stay on the island on the road.

Motorway service station, not possible to walk to/from.

Not too trafficed on a Sunday morning in January 2023. Extremely nice staff at the café  gave me a coffee for free and said I could just go inside if I needed to warm up.

Unfortunately Netflix launched a documentary about a hitchhiker and axmurderer right before I went on a hitchhiking trip, so a lot of people in England said they were to scared to pick me up.

Two middle-aged women wasn't going my direction but bought me a sandwich
Catches heavy outgoing traffic to two different place + traffic lights
Perfect stop for the drivers who can park at the bus station. The cars goes very fast but there is traffic so more chances to be pull ! Waited 10 min.
Think the general lack of drivers picking people up has taken the shine off this spot. Got a ride to Kinross services which was great!
Very fine place towards Aberdeen! Got a ride to Perth in 10 minutes! :] [AdrianB]

First spot i ever hitchhiked from :) 
Used it several times never had to wait longer than 5 minutes and always took me straight up to Dundee! Awesome.

I just want to note that I stood here 90minutes without one person even stopping. This is only the second time this has ever happened to me. Maybe it was the lack of a sign, but eveeryone else's comments were so positive I didn't think i needed one.
Had an M20 sign, lots of traffic

Had a sign M20 Dover
not the best spot, people driving seem not to be very friendly

A relatively good starting spot since it's easy to reach with the overground from London proper. However not too many cars stop at the gas station and they are not stopping for a thumb. I did find a ride that was able to take me at least a bit further on the highway in the direction of Dover for higher chances to find someone to take me further. 
This was around 10 am in mid August.

I live in London and have used this spot a few times, in fact it's where I started my first-ever hitchhiking trip. Never had to wait more than 20 mins with an "M20" sign (I've always been here around 9-11am). This is the ideal spot to start hitchhiking towards Dover/Europe in my opinion!

Scored a ride very quickly with a sign for Maidstone. Ended up helping a couple workers deliver sofas in London for a few hours before getting where I wanted to go, good fun and great spot. Just smile and look friendly as us English are sceptical.

It's an alright spot with space. Most cars do go to Bham though so you'll have to be lucky to find one that takes you north. Only got a short ride from there but it was enough to take me further away from Birmingham.
Got dropped off here begin of April. Got another ride at 2pm within 30min with my sign saying "M6 North". Waited after the petrol station. But you can even ask people at parking area.
I managed to get a lift yesterday from the first person I asked all the way up to nearly Manchester
A lot of cars driving slowly, so it's a good spot.
Plenty of space for cars to stop.
August 2025, gave up after an hour and got a train. It's a bus stop and 3 lanes of traffic, a lot of people waving at me but no one stopped. Maybe just got unlucky
took me 5mins for a ride. V good spot
Got a ride in 15 minutes to the M6.
it's a bus stop called "Broadgreen, The Rocket PH (opp)"
the perfect spot for hitchhiking to Manchester. Waited about 10 min.

Direction east to London. Depends on time propably, but for us car went slow luckilly due to congestion, got picked up in about 10m by a guy, but lots of tourist cars that were already full. Got all the way to Windsor.
A lot of space for cars to stop. Good to go further eastwards on the A303 an to try to get on the M3. Lot of traffic (but maybe a lot of local traffic, must depend of the day and time you're there).
A lot of space for cars to stop. Good to go further eastwards on the A303 an to try to get on the M3

Tried to hitch across the channel from here, but no offers after 8 hours (turned down a few offers to Folkestone/Dover in that time though). Eventually just decided to get a ferry ticket and accepted a ride to Folkestone

Had everything between 5min and 24h of waiting time to Europe. Don't give up. You'll get there eventually. It's still the best option to get a ride to Europe.
There is a microwave that you can use for free in the service.

Friday morning, waited 2 hours 30mins. Most traffic seemed to be heading to London at that time. Very easy to chat to drivers stopping for a coffee though, and was offered a lift through to Calais on the Eurotunnel.

the spot seems ok, peole go slow because it's a rondabout and they can pull over to the petrol station; also you won't miss the ones just stopping for petrol or cigarettes. Anyway, we (2 people) waited there three hours without getting a ride, and met two guys who also got stuck there for half a day. Lucky for us, it's not a bad place to get stuck, even over night.
Found it hard to find somebody going towards Dover while asking at the petrol station. Most were going towards London.
Great services, recommend just chatting to people outside entrance (not petrol station). Lots of traffic going bristol!!
Got a ride to Wales in 20 minutes, just standing by the entrance to the roundabout after the petrol station.
The services are a bit confusing but feasable (direction South to Winchester)
easy to get a lift to a service station on the A1 or M1, used it a couple times now, and the workers don't kick you out

If you're going South, standing near the petrol station here works quite well. However, there are some handy places to stand near bus stops and the like where cars can pull in further into the city, near the racecourse, and if you stand there instead you'll usually get a lift out of town in less time than it would take you to walk to the outskirts.
Quite some bus stops and such closer to York but people don't seem to go towards the A64 much and there's nowhere to pull over near the A64
Good spot, safe, with place to park and with a lot of trafic, although the drivers go to many differents direction (south/north/west). Was fun to do it !
Lots of cars going south. Waited for 2 hours with nothing going north.
Decent spot with steady flow of drivers who are going slowly
This pin is in the wrong spot, please use the pin north of this one

Pretty fine place to thump up. In mz case, I got a lift immediately,  cause cars were stucked in the traffic jam so they had time to check both me and my sign. [there was diverted traffic in that time]
big layby on northbound A82, possibility to take train from \\glasgow Queen Street to Balloch and walk a mile or so to this spot, hitch to Tarbert Loch Fyne, Oban, Fort William
Good traffic flow but many tourists who looked shocked to see a hitchhiker
Bus stop in the middle of Aviemore. Cars are quite slow and have enough space to stop. Only loads of distraction like pedestrians and other cars. Direction Perth (south)

good traffic coming out of services driving slow, opposite this gas station. inside services is good to charge phone, use toilet and get water bottles filled.
lift from Dave
Waited near the car repair bay opposite the petrol station for about 2 hours for a lift North. Lots of families and full cars (it was early August). Not a bad spot in theory.
Held a sign with STIRLING on it for a couple hours in rush hour, not many people willing to stop
this is a realy good spot to go to glasgow, but other destinations, take the bus, that's probably your best bet
Got a lift toward Glasgow in 15 minutes... seems quite good.
Waited at the petrol station, almost an hour in total with a good sign and clean clothes.
We got a lift at the gas station. It took a bit longer than other places (maybe because it was raining) but it looks like a quite good spot.
Did not work for us, we ended up trying M4 hitching points instead
I would also recommend the Shell petrol station a short walk west along the A316
This hitch-hiking spot lies just next to a bus stop, and just after a pedestrian crossing, so the traffic passing this point is quite slow. Good for getting onto the M3
We tried a few times around Inverness and were unsuccessful we came to this spot and someone stopped within 10 minutes. It's at the entrance of the highway so people are just starting to speed up
this is one of the spots where you really should have a sign.

There's a pull-off on the highway here. Great spot to get South or East. Make sure your sign says which one though - mine said Edinburgh Please, and I got a ride within 15 minutes. Seen lots of hitchers at this spot and they always get picked up. Stand a bit before the spot where the road widens and people should have heaps of time to pull over.
Lots of local traffic but we got a ride to Castlewellan very quickly. Lot of space for car to stop and shops in the nearby to hide if rains

Hitchhiking to Newry.
Lots of car but mostly family car full so they have no place.
Lots of place to stop.
Wait 20min
It took a while to find someone, but at the end I asked someone who was filling his tank, going to Exeter.
Most people go to the ring road, but at the end i found someone who went to Exeter.

[THIS IS A SHELL GARAGE]
[A316 SW -> M3]

The garage attendant did not mind me waiting here with sign for M3 / A303. I had no clear defined plan other than to go South West. Within 30 minutes I was offered a hitch all the way to Cornwall but only went as far as Bruton, Somerset. Good spot as a large proportion of traffic will be heading down the M3 and it is the last petrol station before the motorway begins although it is worth bearing in mind that much of that traffic will be headed round the

Walk to the front of the ferry with a big smile on your face, making eye contact with drivers. Politely ask the ferry dudes if you can get off first so you can hitchike, and then with their approval, dash off up the ramp the second they let you, to somewere with a little space, and thumbs away! ignore the crowd of startled normies who will inevitably have their phones out to video the strange hitchiker. I've gotten rides repeatedly this way on both sides. On this occasion 2 mins took me to Mull!
Corran ferry, Fort William  side . Bad  in summer  -  mainly  tourists  .

Friend and I (women) hitched from here 2023 Autumn. It was getting dark and we still got a lift! The whole island was pretty good for hitchhiking (although there weren't many cars).
The bus system is pretty good too, as a back up ;)
Used a residential drive just down from the roundabout as a place for cars to pull over

Got a ride in less than 5 minutes but felt we got very lucky. This is very small lay-by on the side of the roundabout intended for police vehicles. Have to target traffic coming round the roundabout as those from the close exit would have used the slip road (from M25 N). Drivers are held at traffic lights so gives them a good chance to see you.
Small place for cars to stop just before the M20 sign (direction south). If you zoom in you can see it in white on the map. Took me 10 mins to get a ride to Maidstone.
If I'd known the alternatives closer to London I would've taken those, but got a ride from here to Maidstone services pretty quickly anyway. Not the best spot, but doable.

Scotch Corner was my longest ever hitching wait - we're talking about several hours, and then having to camp there overnight, to continue trying to hitch in the morning. I stood at the exit from the services with my thumb out. A massive amount of people stopped to offer rides, but EVERY single one was going South, and I wanted to get to Scotland. Thankfully, the services have free toilets, plug sockets in the corridors, and food. I slept behind the bushes, and it was okay. Since then, I've hitch
Very busy for people going south. Still useful for people going north.
Got a lift in ~1 hour down to Leeds on a Tuesday morning (0900 - 1000). Had camped at the North end of the car park previous night.
Where do you hitch from here? Layby or services?
Never had any bad blood going North, but heading South I was stuck there was an ungodly wait.
Waited for 15 mins and a guy took me to the Peak district
Find rides to Manchester from this road. Hitch from this point, or keep walking along Manchester Road until you find a more suitable place. For more info, see http://www.hitchwiki.org/Sheffield
Gas station is now closed. It is much harder for cars to pull over as the entrance is slightly barricaded. You could still try to hitch a ride with the nearby traffic lights, but I did not.

It is a busy road and there are a lot of lorries all the time. Sometimes they have to stop on the lights. That's your chance to walk up to them and ask them. Also keep an Eye on the Petrol station, although most people there are Locals and the owner doesn't want Hitchers approaching people.

going to clais, france. if you haven't managed to get a lift before, this is most probably the place to be... next to petrol station and just before the traffic light where many people have to stop. i stood here twice (~30min/~5min) with an a4 sign stating 'Ferry?'. after having eye contact with somebody waiting at the traffic light you have to be quick to jump in or the driver of a car might also turn left into the small road... on the ferry you can ask people in order to change your lift. i ne
Didn't work. After maybe one hour the guy from the gas station told me to leave because I would be to dangerous.
After 15 min I found a ride to a gas station close to London.
Short run-up for cars to see you, although there is a service station that people slow down to go into. Lots of cars going through here midday which helps.
Decent spot, mind the trucks piling up, got a lift heading down the M1

I've hitched from here twice, both southbound across the M42 to M5. The first time we got stuck for several hours and had to start approaching people as night was drawing in. We made it eventually. The second time I got a quick pickup here BUT misheard the guy and got dropped halfway along M42. Bad move - got really stuck. In my experience M42 south is quite sticky so try to do it in one ride if at all possible. If you're just heading down the M1 though, you'll be fine from here.
Waited 1h30, trying all types of techniques. Oue driver told us that they are not allowed to stop on this type of motorway entry

Roundabout just by the entrance to M1 junction 11. This is not a great spot by any means - I only used it by necessity. However, I guess if you're starting your journey in Luton this might be a decent spot. Alternatively try Flamstead services just off the motorway at junction 9. A trucker told me he thought that would be a better bet.

Despite the wait time we felt this was a good spot and we were just unlucky. We had a good number of offers but all were heading anti-clockwise on M25, we wanted to go clockwise. Best bet here is to just wait at the entrance to the petrol and ask everyone as they fill up. Lots of van drivers going round the M25. Eventually got a lift over the dartford crossing.
Was asking around here, tryingto get onto the m25 (dartford maybe). Took really long, because everybody here was local. They were all really nice and helpfull though.
Lots of trucks and some local traffic. Found someone to take me to Dover after 30 minutes of asking around in mid August around 11 am.
Ideal for getting to Maidstone, had another 15 minute wait asking people filling up. There's also a McDonalds round the corner which is usually if you're a pair.
Probably a good spot still to hitch in all direction (North - West) from London but it is more harsh to continue towards the South-East from there.

I agree with the other post. You can get access to this place from the road that drives paralel to the motorway, the fence is broken at the point where my marker is spotted. There are buses stoping on the road, you should be able to catch one from swanley towards here. Becareful, there is a MacDonalds.
only local traffic!
Had a sign saying M6 North, got a lift to Preston with a lovely bloke. Didn't take long at all but it was at around 5pm so a few people were heading home
How do you get stuck for 27 hours? Anyway, I got a ride in about 5 minutes going around, asking drivers in the dark. The guy asked me to show him my ID, but took me almost home in Manchester.

Going to Scotland. Tried here at night, very little traffic, noone stopping. 

Got a lift in the morning after a couple of hours on the road before the petrol station, but only because someone got stuck behind a truck and had time to think about it for a while.
I waited around 35 minutes for a car to take me west onto the M56. It was quite quiet.

3   bad  experiences   so far in 2013  going  south ....no cars . expect  to wait 90 minutes  and then   be  offered  a lift   to Hilton Park Services  , Wolverhampton  , which is  also  a 90 minute wait. Avoid Kuntsford and Hilton Pk . The rest of M6  is ok

I ended up here multiple times while hitching to stoke-on-trent (about half an hour south on the motorway so NOT an uncommon place for drivers to pass.)
I'd always get a lift eventually but it would take ages, an hour or two, and I'm a lone young woman so most people will wait longer.

Loads of Trucks! I was heading to Ireland, I just talked to every truck driver chilling at the parking place. Most of them were going Far south. (London even Dover) Eventually an Irish trucker took me all the way to Dublin, He even payed the boat ticket for me.

Not good for the M6 North. Most people travel along the M56. I wait at the service station exit. 
Good 24 hour services - they didn't mind me dozing in the cafe.
A sign is recommended.

I got a ride to here from Heston Services. 2 minutes after getting out, at 3am on a December morning, I got a ride up to Glasgow. Try standing just before where the lorries exit, it is safe and easy for them to stop here.

Asking around at this truck station is your best bet instead of the ramps. Trucks tend to be heading South especially in the evening but there are literally a hundred rigs there later in the day, and although most are laid up you will probably be able to get a night journey. There is a Cafe (expensive) where you can chat to drivers or just walk around with a sign, which works for me. Had one of the best rides ever in the UK from here.

After looking for a good spot in Dover for a while I arrived here and the first car I asked was willing to take me on the ferry (despite being sceptical if that would work) and straight to my destination in Germany. Lots of international cars there in general.
I was going to France and waited there around half an hour but I was very lucky. Is is good to have a board. Nearby there is a BP station, you can ask there - some people go to France as well.
Pretty bad for direction Ashford/London/Brighton - most people stay in town.

Mostly local people stop at this petrol station, so they are not taking the ferry. However, it is easier to get a ride when you can talk to people first. After standing at the busstop in Townwall Street for 4 hours, we decided to try here and convinced someone to take us within 15 mins.
1 boy 1 girl in December 2023. Not a great spot at all, but it does yield... we got a ride through the night to Germany and free dinner on the ferry because we were with a truck :-)
Two guys trying to get over the channel. Gave up after 3 hours. We don't look dodgy either.

Me and my girlfriend stood on the exit roundabout for two minutes with an EU sign and a guy picked us up, took us on the ferry and drove us all the way to Brugge in Belgium.
I think this station is good because the cars for Europe go either to the Eurotunnel or on the ferry.
Hitched from here in summer, two men, still took quite long. Last services before dover / folkestone, a lot of people crossing the thames but most full cars.
Tried to hitch from here for hours but with no luck. Eventually walked to Westenhanger station.

Arrived at 4.30 Friday afternoon and asked pretty much everyone coming into the services. Almost all were coming back from France, not heading there - lots of locals too. Had to sleep overnight in the Costa which the staff were okay with. Got a ride the next morning at 7 across the tunnel. No luck with the truck drivers who didn't want to talk to us.
