You've got to just talk to everybody. Lots of friendly people too.
Early in the morning it's not a good place - most of the traffic are local people on their way to work just stopping for a coffee.

waited for an hour - right at the spot where the exit of the parking space is, onto the road that leads to the exit. Cars go slowly, people can see you from the distance and consider it, and you're close to the mcdonalds, for free wi-fi, toilet, water, etc.

I tried this spot to get a ride over the Channel Tunnel, because people are coming out of the parking lot very slowly and it is easy to stop for them to chat with me, but unfortunately most of them ride full cars or are locals or travelling in a different direction, so I only managed to get a ride after 2 hours.
Great spot! some local trafic unfortunatly
towards Glasgow, stand about 200 metres out of town from the Tesco, not a great place but better than walking out towards industrial estate
Waited for an hour in the rain in january before giving up. Feels like it should be easier than it is

If you want to get out of the city centre then this is an average spot. The problem is that much of the traffic isn't going far. You might wait 2 hours and get a ride to Bothwell services, which aren't great either. Usage of a sign is highly recommended.
Got picked up by the police after waiting for 40 minutes. They were nice, but you know, you don’t want that to happen.
Good spot to get rides south.
Not a good spot anymore, since there's a new bypass on the A68. Waited a while before giving up, trying to get to Dalkeith and then luckily some guy dropped me at the first village on the road.
cars passes by (average 10 cars per minute) not so fast, easy for them to see you and park easily for you.

At this place not so many cars passes by but it is just a place for cars to stop. They are not so fast and they can see you from far away. There is a gas station after more 10 min walking if you need something or if you want to ask people for a ride.
Not a good stop at all. Very dangerous road/the cars go too fast and have no place to park. We went back to the petrol station.
Good spot to go North to Inverness or the Highlands !
Dosnt exist anymore.
First Layby on A9
Two people stopped in less than 10 minutes, the first guy wasn't going in to London. No hassle with police, but maybe that's because it was so quick!
Do not try hitchhiking here as it's illegal to do so on the motorway. Cops came and told us we had to leave after half an hour. Go to the gas station.

We tried hitch hiking while we waited for the bus. It was a 50/50 success rate for the whole island. Sometimes there just wasn't enough traffic to get a lift (and then we'd get the bus). Sometimes we'd get lucky (got a lift from the local policeman once! Lovely fellow).
Autumn, 2024
I hh around both to go to the castle and to go south (on the main road) and it wasn't as easy as I expected but anyway got the lifts I needed in less than 30 minutes each.
Not much traffic.
Very low in traffic. But space to stop. Cheers to the Vale of the White Horse Ramblers club

Maidstoners aren't generally the hitching type... I tend to get a lot of confused and/or disgruntled stares when hitching to London from around here. But hey, this is the roundabout which leads onto the main motorway which goes to London.

Cornwall services is here so a good spot to ask around. I stood at the turn onto the A30. The cold wind and sleet helped, the road is just wide enough for a car to pull onto the grass and not stop traffic. Not ideal though

This lane was heading exactly in my direction, although not a good stopping spot I had a very short wait. There’s a bus stop on the other side of the roundabout that would be safer for a car to pull in

Not a prime spot. The west road going directly onto the motorway is fast with no ideal spot for a car to stop. The north road allows a car to stop though but much less traffic passing on it. My lift did come from the west road and pulled just off the road onto the grass so not entirely impossible just inconvenient.
Cars going fast. But the turn off gives some an opportunity to stop for you
A decent spot. There's a layby just before the roundabout. Get dropped here if your ride is going the wrong way for you off the roundabout.
Hitched a couple times here for bummit. okay for going north but cars a bit too fast

Not too bad, find for Leicester.
Wait near station service.
Not the best spot because of the lack of room, but we've been taken in 1 min in direction of Fort William ! A lot of trafic there ;)
Some people will stop. Some won't. Everywhere is hitchable, but remember Unst is suuuuper empty.
If buses are delayed drivers may stop and help.
Offered lifts by drivers going into town on multiple occasions. Cars go fast... Little room, there is a layby at the top of the rise... Might also be good
Not alot of space to stop but quick lift none the less
Sign required as lots of destinations
Not great sightline. Got picked up by someone who circled round.

Cars are not going too fast.
Good to have a sign with the name of the motorway.
Almost no space to stop but there was not a lot traffic so cars could stop quickly on the road.
Cars can't really pull over safely. They need to stop on the middle off the road in front of the busstop. Cars drive slowly because of roundabout and traffic.
Caught a ride to service station near Bristol. Cars are going quite fast, however they can pull over at the cafe if they can read your sign well enough.

was offered a lift by a couple by me having lunch at the cafe.
ride from Maryann & Ewan

decent layby and lots of traffic.
ride from Scott

good layby but a lot of tourists/campervans i guess who seemed less keen to pick me up.
lift from Llewellyn all the way to Oban

lots of not too fast traffic when i was there.
lift from Jeg n Craig

decent place to stand on this corner, lots of traffic. picked up by a taxi driver on their way back to base.
ride from Malik

had to ask around at the Otter pools to be able to get out of there after a day of hiking. first person said yes. was doubtful i would be able to hitch off the carpark as it's mainly families here.
lift from Chrissy n Will

was offered a lift from a man on his way to work in his van, so not necessarily a hitching spot though clearly the people of this town are friendly and you might have luck asking around to get to the next town.
ride from Gem

not loads of traffic so might have been lucky to get a lift here.
ride from empty schoolbus driver.

asked around at the truckstop after having no luck thumbing on this road.  tourists weren't interested but got luck with a van. i camped the night before in the forest adjacent (discreetly).
ride from Jay

risky as it's illegal to stand on the motorway but luckily I was picked up by the first car.
ride from Rob
Waited by the exit for ages. People were friendly but took a long time to get picked up.

Trying to get to London with a sign. Waited on the side of the exit that leads onto the M5 for 30 minutes. Then moved to the entrance of the services and waited for 20 minutes before a nice lady with her dog picked me up and took me as far as she could.
Not the best spot as it’s just a country road. But was able to get a ride to the Glenshee Ski lefts quickly
There was lots of traffic, but its hard for cars to stop, though possible. Found a nice guy after 30 Minutes.

Not a suitable place to turn out, and traffic is a little fast, but I still managed to get someone. They turned back and got me. They were a wonderful old couple who go out for a pleasure drive in this gorgeous countryside every week. They were delighted to take me to my destination in Edale and buy us dinner at the Inn there! This is why I hitch hike!

Didn't get picked up after 3.5hrs on a Monday, holding a sign that read "SOUTH".  It's probably the best spot to catch someome heading south as there's a road and a hotel forecourt just beyond this spot they can pull in to.  One car pulled up but they were heading south-east to Wick.  A lady rode past on a bicycle and commented "good luck, they're all miserable 'round ere!" 😂
cars  driving very  fast  off from  the  roundabout   into  M5  South   , , ,  don't have  time  to see your  sign or  stop
Lot of people going in Edinburgh's direction, plus you have a service station nearby.
Not a great spot. Nowhere good to be seen well but it's a service station so cars are slow. Some cars go to M6 north/south or to Penrith... So you need luck to find the right one
Nice but transphobic old man gave me a ride to Berwick on tweed even though he lived in Eyemouth. I think I was lucky though, throughput not high.

[did this back in November 2024]
It was 9 pm, dark and cold and I had my bike. I asked the few cars that came here (4 in total) and the last one agreed to take me and my bike up the big hill leading to Dover
Regularly, as a student, 1966-69.

Asked the petrol station if they minded if I hitch hiked out the front. One of them offered me a lift if I waited until they finished work! Otherwise I think it would have been a bit more tricky.
Summer 2024

Cars aren't allowed to stop here, but it's the only spot in Perth to catch all traffic heading north. 
We got lucky and got a ride within 30 minutes. Risky spot for drivers to stop but if they want to help they will
Off to see the seals. Better on the main road. Avoid dual carriagways and stay on bigger roads

I walked off the ferry and was offered a couple of short rides, but stupidly turned them down. Don't. There is very little traffic and for some reason a weirdly high rejection rate. I walked all the way here from the ferry thumbing as I went before I got picked up. Wtf uist?
Went here from Scars Beach to hitch to the ferry. Not great but cars stop anyway.
Most of the traffic is on the further lanes and accelerating quickly, but hitching the traffic coming from nearby shops worked well eventually
The spot is okay but drivers seems to don't like when there is no real parking stop. Having a sign may be good
Good pull in for drivers if you are heading north but most were going too fast.
Not ideal spot, not a lot of room to park for the car but they usually aren't too fast so they have time to spot you
Spot not ideal, road is narrow and cars can't really park on the side. We got a car pretty quickly (very touristic area) but they stopped in the middle of the road to take us in
Spot not ideal we were on the side of the road. There's a carpark nearby but it was on the other side of the road.
Didn't wait for long but not really ideal to hitchhike. The car stopped in the middle of the  road.
Waited only 10 mins before getting a lift to Chesterfield. Lots of traffic going short distances South out of Sheffield

Very frequent offers for lifts, but all heading in the wrong direction (apparently) up North - we were trying to head South. Standing on this point you can ask all the customers coming out the drive through with their windows down so easy to talk. to everyone. Eventually got a lift along the M25 from someone taking pity on us, while he was parked eating his lunch.
Got picked up surprisingly quick but think we got lucky. The guy actually saw us and turned around. Try it further up the road where there's more space to brake
It admittedly wasn't a great spot but was my first ever time, I got a bit lucky, I'd recommend other places there

Update from Okt 2023: i didnt find it possible to hitch further into the port than this (the workers tell you to leave and there isnt an obvious spot). This worked for me though, even though it was evening and dark, standing with a sign right at the exit of the roundabout into the ferry port. Theres a little spot to pull over also. I had a sign with “ferry:)” got me a ride unto the ferry and then I found a truckdriver that went bear Brussels. The truckdrivers have a special section in the ferry,
Slow traffic

Big wide bus stop right in front of hospital, great for cars to pull over. Two cars stopped in the first 10 minutes, but were only going a few hundred meters, so may be a good place to get out of the city at least. A few cars slowed down to stare at us, then sped back up again. After almost an hour someone took us to our destination 20 min down the road.
Apparently Ballymena has a bad reputation and people dont like people from there, so do your best to look as foreign and exotic as possible.

Didn't get a ride with a sign stating 'Towards Dover' after waiting 30 mins. There's two small roads on the left side where cars might be able to pull over. Cars going quite fast and might go into several directions after the spot, which possibly makes this a tricky place to hitchhike.
Not much place for cars to stop, but we got lucky, someone pulled over on roundabout right away and got us out of crosshands where we'd been stuck for 3 hours

Cars going slowly from Narberth to the A40. A nice place to stop in a driveway. However, very little traffic, and because of a curve they cant see you from a distance. We were going to cardiff so after some 15 minutes we walked past the roundabout on a40 looking for better spot.
The truck stop at Carlisle was a good 2 hour wait. The drivers are nervous that other drivers report them. Best heading to the sliproads
Waited about 3 hours to get a ride to get to Inverness with one go.
On the way to Oxford.. when heavy traffic, you can get someone on traffic lights

Bus stop - sign probably necessary. Possibility for the cars to stop without problems. I got a ride out to the first service station heading north fairly quick in January 2023. The motorway ahead goes both way so probably possible to get south as well.
got a ride to barnstaple after 30 min of waiting at around 6pm, carr have a good run up to see you, most ignore but stay hopeful
Quite a good place for hitching as a large road with places to pull off.
A good spot to go to the next village from.
Pretty crappy service station spot, got a ride eventually north
Can hitch from junction opposite of high school but most cars are just local traffic.
There is a petrol station opposite of the Ben nevis destillery. Good spot to HH in case it rains. Rides to malaigh and inverness

Most traffic passing through is crossing the channel. The bus stop allows plenty of space for stopping and you are visible from far away.

Be aware that the leftmost lane (where cars will be able to access you) is normally a truck lane.

Locals I spoke to use this spot semi-regularly.

When crossing, make sure to check with your driver that he/she can add an additional passenger to their ticket. If they booked directly with the ferry company then it shouldn't be an issue. If through an age
Great gateway-spot. I waited 15 min and a woman took me to the gas station up the hill in her Jaguar. From there I quickly found a ride to London (could've gone to Luton if I wanted)

It looked like an hopeless point, but in the end we got a ride in less than one hour. I suppose just luck, because it's not easy to stop for vehicles in a fast line, and many trucks on this side (not good if you are a couple)

Traffic is fairly fast, the left lane is mostly for Lorries, which are almost to fast to stop, it feels quite hopeless. I had more luck at the Traffic lights up the road at the petrol station, when lorries have to stop.

Not amazing spot to get onto ferry, but at least there's a bus stop. I only stayed there half an hour with no luck. A lot of lorries take the 1st lane, and there's no space for them to stop, so smaller cars have no way of stopping at bus stop.
The spot is good for cars to stop but i waited for 6hrs and nobody took me.
Good spot, there's a lane for cars to stop, got a ride here on a Friday 10.30pm within 5min.
The last spot to change directions between M5 and M4. Got a ride to Reading.
Got a lift back to London after equinox standing on services exit
Seemed difficult to hitch east as no layby or hard shoulder for cars to stop. then again, my tired bad mood may have coloured my opinion.

at the gasstation you stand dry, but the guy working there will ask you to leave, the older lady doesnt matter, got not lucky so moved to the traffic lights
i was going eastbound
Decent room to stop, catches slow traffic coming from the city as well as faster bypass drivers. Got a ride to Inverness in 10 minutes
There is no gas station anymore (Aug 2024)

After the staff of the petrol station told me it was a private property and I had to go because I was annoying their clients, I stood for one hour near the bus stop, hoping a truck would stop, but it didn't work.
Taunton  25  M5  northbound  very  tight  pull=in  and  too  busy  for  cars  safely  stopping
, dense and  very   fast traffic  is  reluctant  to pull up and there is  no hard shoulder.

There is a little snack bar along the road with possibility to talk to people or the space for a potential car to pull aside (there is also a bus stop between that spot and the roundabout but the visibility is low)
